item.title: HP has announced a new promotion offering free roaming Wi-Fi for specific notebooks and tablets
item.description: HP and iPass, the largest Wi-Fi network globally, recently revealed a partnership. Select HP laptops and tablets will now offer access to the iPass network. Source: HP website. This collaboration aims to provide users in Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ) with easier and more budget-friendly internet access both locally and during their travels. Customers purchasing new HP laptops and tablets with this feature will enjoy automatic access to millions of hotspots on the iPass network for a year, free of charge, upon registration.

item.title: Air France provides complimentary newspapers and magazines for tablets
item.description: Air France has launched a new app, Air France Press, allowing Flying Blue members to enjoy complimentary digital media offline. Flying Blue members can download a selection of French and international newspapers and magazines at no cost. This content is accessible offline before, during, and after their Air France flights. Passengers can download publications with their ticket, starting 24 hours before their flight until departure. Access to the service is granted by logging into the app using Flying Blue credentials or a reservation number.

item.title: Bosign is broadening its range of technology products
item.description: Bosign, a privately held Swedish company known for designing, patenting, and producing reasonably priced, top-notch Scandinavian lifestyle products, has introduced a new line of tech accessories for mobile device users. A standout feature of the new iPad Carrying Sleeve is its discreet leather fold-out handles, offering a convenient alternative for carrying the iPad. Measuring 28cm wide, 21cm high, and 1.2cm deep, the iPad Carrying Sleeve is crafted from felt to shield iPads from scratches and dust.

item.title: Targus introduces the T-1211 line of laptop and tablet cases
item.description: Targus, a company known for its laptop cases and accessories, has introduced the T-1211 collection, a new line of laptop and tablet cases designed for both work and everyday commutes. The T-1211 cases have a sleek, minimalist design accented by a subtle crosshatch pattern. Every case in the collection features a water-resistant exterior and a scratch-resistant interior lining. The T-1211 13.3”-17” Backpack offers a spacious yet streamlined design with multiple compartments for organization.

item.title: Get inspired anywhere with a Microsoft Surface
item.description: Mindflyer utilizes the Surface, with his design for the angpows displayed on the screen. The artwork features his interpretation of Nian, a mythical creature symbolizing the arrival of spring. The Microsoft Surface series presents an excellent option for creative professionals. Singaporean artist Michael Ng, known professionally as Mindflyer, was commissioned to design red packets for Microsoft in 2019. Ng shared that the Surface platform is well-suited for his commissioned work, which he creates entirely on a Surface tablet.

item.title: You can now pre-order the new Microsoft Surface 3
item.description: At an event in Singapore in April, bloggers were given the opportunity to test out the Surface 3, as well as the Lumia 640 and 640 XL. The Surface Pro was a hit, but some users desired more. Ian Tan, the Surface Lead for Consumer at Microsoft Singapore, revealed during a media event that certain customers requested a lighter, more budget-friendly device, a request to which Microsoft paid attention.

item.title: Altec Lansing introduces durable mobile accessories at CES
item.description: Altec Lansing is launching new lines of durable chargers, power banks, cables, and cases for smartphones and tablets. Expected to be available around the second quarter of 2016, these accessories will have rugged features like IP67-rated, military-grade construction for waterproof, dustproof, and shock-resistant functionality and device protection. The new products will include: Altec Lansing Everything Proof Power Packs (3,000, 6,000, and 10,000 mAh): These power banks are designed for smartphones, tablets, and MP3 players, offering up to 100 hours of talk time, 75 hours of music, 50 hours of video, or 4.

item.title: Enhance car safety with 360-degree hands-free device viewing
item.description: Sprint-Cass, the sole distributor of Taiwanese brand Digidock in Singapore, is introducing a new line of Digidock mobile device holders for vehicles at IT Show 2015, happening from March 19th to 22nd at the Suntec Convention Centre. These holders are designed for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. Every Digidock holder features a 360-degree swivel joint, allowing users to securely position their smartphones or tablets at any desired angle. Engineered for simple attachment and removal, the holders come with interchangeable cradles and universal mounts.

item.title: Singtel has announced that the iPad Pro is now available
item.description: Source: Apple. Singtel now offers the new iPad Pro with Wi-Fi + Cellular. This tablet boasts a 12.9-inch Retina display, packing 5.6 million pixels for exceptional resolution, and its size rivals some laptops. Customers can also purchase smart cases and silicone covers. According to a Singtel representative, “Singtel will offer iPad Pro with a variety of attractive data plans that will allow customers to connect to its tri-band 4G network.

item.title: 2020 Christmas Gift Guide: Must-Have Gadgets for the Holiday Season
item.description: As the year ends, it’s the perfect time to treat yourself. Check out these gadgets for relaxation and maybe even work: OPPO Find X2 Pro smartphone The OPPO Find X2 Pro blends technology and elegant design. Marketed as “a cinema in your hand,” it boasts a 120 Hz QHD+ Ultra Vision screen with exceptional resolution, color, refresh rate, and brightness. Enjoy immersive audio and video with its powerful dual speakers and Dolby Atmos.

item.title: The market welcomes four new Surfaces
item.description: Microsoft has introduced four new Surface products designed for the modern world. Source: Microsoft website. The Surface Pro 6. “Today, people need devices and technology that move with them and are ready whenever and wherever inspiration strikes,” stated Microsoft Chief Product Officer, Panos Panay, in a blog post. “That’s the power of Surface, Windows, and Office working together through the cloud to provide the perfect tool. We designed these products together, optimizing every detail to empower your productivity and creativity.

item.title: The Flickr App for iPad has been optimized for iOS 8
item.description: Yahoo has launched a new Flickr app designed for iPads, allowing users seamless photo management across all devices. Yahoo claims the app is optimized for iOS 8, providing an enhanced experience for capturing, editing, and browsing images. Source: Yahoo. Current iPad users can update their existing Flickr app, while new users can download it from the App Store. The app supports multiple languages, including English, French, Indonesian, Korean, Chinese, and Vietnamese.

item.title: Acer introduces new convertible notebooks, the Aspire R 13 and R 14
item.description: Acer has introduced two new convertible notebook lines, the Aspire R 13 and Aspire R 14 Series, both capable of transitioning between various notebook and tablet modes. These notebooks are designed for users seeking the functionality of a traditional notebook with added flexibility. Source: Acer. The R 13 in one mode. Acer’s CEO, Jason Chen, stated that their objective is to exceed expectations with their products at every price point. He believes these Aspire convertibles are ideal for users who require both portability and productivity.

item.title: Fujitsu introduces new mobile products in Japan
item.description: Source: Fujitsu. The LIFEBOOK U7310/D. Fujitsu and its subsidiary, Fujitsu Client Computing, have introduced new mobile devices designed to support the changing workstyles of their customers, particularly in remote work environments. The new product lineup consists of nine FUJITSU Notebook LIFEBOOK models, four Fujitsu Tablet ARROWS Tab models (running on Windows), and a Fujitsu Workstation CELSIUS model. These devices are equipped with the latest CPUs and operating systems, with the exception of the CELSIUS model*.

item.title: Dell introduces an improved range of PCs for both consumer and commercial markets
item.description: Dell debuted groundbreaking personal computing innovations at the annual Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in the US. They also updated their XPS, Inspiron, and Alienware consumer lines. Their OptiPlex, Latitude, and Precision commercial products received upgrades to 7th Gen Intel Core processors, USB-C with Thunderbolt 3 connectivity, and new professional graphics from NVIDIA and AMD. Dell’s monitor lineup also saw a refresh. The new Dell PC portfolio is equipped with Windows 10 and 7th Gen Intel Core processors, designed to maximize user productivity and creativity.

item.title: The new iPad Air 2 from Apple is thinner
item.description: Apple unveiled its slimmest iPad yet, the iPad Air 2, at a highly anticipated event on October 16th. The updated iPad boasts an enhanced Retina display for improved contrast, a richer color palette, and superior cameras. Available in gold, alongside the classic silver and space gray, both the iPad Air 2 and the new iPad mini 3 feature Touch ID. In the US, these models will also offer Apple Pay, a new payment system.

item.title: HP has released a variety of mobile solutions to enhance business productivity
item.description: HP has introduced a suite of commercial mobility solutions aimed at boosting workplace productivity. The offerings include eight new mobile devices and accessories designed to simplify business processes. Anneliese Olson, HP Asia-Pacific and Japan VP and GM of Personal Computing, highlighted how these products address evolving workplace dynamics, workforce trends, and work styles, ultimately reshaping workflows. HP has developed a comprehensive mobility solution catering to diverse businesses, including those in specialized sectors like education, field service, healthcare, public safety, and retail.

item.title: HP introduces two phablets in the Indian market
item.description: HP has introduced two new mobile devices to their collection: the 6-inch HP Slate6 VoiceTab and the 7-inch HP Slate7 VoiceTab. These “voice tablets” will be released in India this February*. These devices combine the functions of a phone and a tablet into one portable design. “The voice tablet market is growing because consumers want to combine their phones and tablets into one device,” said Ron Coughlin, Senior VP of HP’s Consumer Personal Systems Group.

item.title: Acer unveils three convertible notebooks
item.description: Acer has expanded its line of 2-in-1 notebooks with the new 11.6" Aspire Switch 11 series and a new Switch 10 featuring a 1080p Full HD 10.1" display. The Aspire Switch 2-in-1 series combines a Microsoft Windows notebook and tablet in one device. Source: Acer. The Aspire Switch 10. The Aspire Switch series is thin, lightweight, and durable, designed for work and travel. It supports four modes: touch, typing, viewing, and sharing.

item.title: HTC has released the Android-powered Nexus 9, with pre-orders starting on October 17th
item.description: HTC teamed up with Google to create the Nexus 9, the first tablet to launch with Android Lollipop*. This premium tablet is designed for an exceptional user experience. The Nexus 9 allows for extensive customization and features a suite of secure login functions for enhanced security. Multi-tasking is made easy with this device. The tablet boasts an 8.9-inch display with a 4:3 aspect ratio, all within a sleek brushed aluminum frame.
